sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Arts Council Act.

sections.heading: Council created.
sections.text:
There is created the Illinois Arts
Council, an agency of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: Expenses.
sections.text:
No member may receive compensation for his services,
but each member may be reimbursed for expenses incurred in the performance of
his duties.
A member of the Council who experiences a significant financial hardship
due to the loss of income on days of attendance at meetings or while otherwise
engaged in the business of the Council may be paid a hardship allowance, as
determined by and subject to the approval of the Governor's Travel Control
Board.

sections.heading: As soon as practicable after this Act becomes effective, the
sections.text:
members shall meet and organize and designate, by majority vote, some
person to act as Secretary, who shall keep a record of all proceedings. The
Council shall act officially only in a meeting duly called by the Chairman
or at a regular meeting fixed by resolution of the Council, adopted by
majority vote.

sections.heading: The Council has the power and duty (a) to survey and assess the
sections.text:
needs of the arts, both visual and performing, throughout the State; (b) to
identify existing legislation, policies and programs which affect the arts
and to evaluate their effectiveness; (c) to stimulate public understanding
and recognition of the importance of cultural institutions in Illinois; (d)
to promote an encouraging atmosphere for creative artists residing in
Illinois; (e) to encourage the use of local resources for the development
and support of the arts; and (f) to report to the Governor and to the
General Assembly biennially, on or about the third Monday in January of
each odd-numbered year, the results of and its recommendations based upon
its investigations.

sections.heading: Arts and foreign language education grants
sections.text: The Council has the authority as set forth in Section 2-3.65a of the School Code concerning the administration and award of grants.

sections.heading: The Council may accept offers of gifts or grants from the federal
sections.text:
government, its agencies or officers, or from any person, firm or
corporation of services, equipment, supplies, materials or funds and may
expend such receipts on projects which it considers suitable to performance
of its duties under this Act.
